New Records: Lars Nootbaar and Paul Goldschmidt hit back-to-back home runs in the first inning, the first time this season the Cardinals have hit consecutive homers
Key Match Events: The Rockies' rally from an 8-5 deficit began after Ryan Fernandez had struck out the first two batters in the inning, then gave up a double, single, walk and another double before Kyle Leahy replaced him on the mound
Kyle Leahy gave up an RBI double on his first pitch and then gave up another double that capped a five-run inning and sent the Rockies to the victory
Pre-Game Insights: The Cardinals were trying to sweep a series in Colorado for the first time since 2004
They also were trying to match their season-high five-game winning streak, set from May 20-26
Post-Match Reflections: The loss snapped a four-game winning streak for the Cardinals
This was the third time this season the Cardinals lost a game despite scoring eight or more runs (15-3 in those games)
Miscellaneous Highlights: Paul Goldschmidt took over the team lead with his 22nd home run of the season
The Cardinals were just 1-of-9 with runners in scoring position
Others: The Cardinals will close out the season with three games this weekend against the Giants in San Francisco
Miles Mikolas is scheduled to start the opener on Friday night
